Class RangeQuery

java.lang.Object
  org.xml.sax.helpers.DefaultHandler
      pgrid.util.LexicalDefaultHandler
          pgrid.AbstractQuery
              pgrid.RangeQuery
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, ContentHandler, DTDHandler, EntityResolver, ErrorHandler, LexicalHandler, Query, QueryInterface, RangeQueryInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
RangeQueryMessage
public class RangeQuery
extends AbstractQuery
implements RangeQueryInterface

This class represent a range query message

Author:
Renault JOHN
See Also:

          Sequential algorithm which consist in finding dynamicaly the next neighbor and send the range query to it.

static String SHOWER_ALGORITHM
          Parallel algorithm which consist in sending the range query to all sub-tree this peer is responsible of.

Field Detail

MINMAX_ALGORITHM

public static String MINMAX_ALGORITHM
Sequential algorithm which consist in finding dynamicaly the next neighbor and send the range query to it.

SHOWER_ALGORITHM

public static String SHOWER_ALGORITHM
Parallel algorithm which consist in sending the range query to all sub-tree this peer is responsible of.

mBoundsKeys

protected KeyRange mBoundsKeys
Bounds keys of the range query

mFirstQueryString

protected String mFirstQueryString
The first search string.

mSecondQueryString

protected String mSecondQueryString
The second search string.

mAlgorithm

protected String mAlgorithm
Indicate which algorithm to choose. Legal values are sequential or parallel

mPrefix

protected String mPrefix
prefix of the expected path for the current range query

SEPARATOR

public static final String SEPARATOR
Range query separator

Constructor Detail

RangeQuery

protected RangeQuery()
Creates a new empty range Query.

RangeQuery

public RangeQuery(GUID guid,
                  Type type,
                  String algorithm,
                  String minQuery,
                  String maxQuery,
                  KeyRange kr,
                  String prefix,
                  int minSpeed,
                  int hops,
                  PGridHost initialHost)
Construct a range query message

Parameters:
guid - the unique range query number
type - the type of the query
minQuery - least bound
maxQuery - max bound
kr - bounds of the range query
minSpeed - the connection speed
hops - number of hops taken by this query
initialHost - host that should recieve the result set

RangeQuery

public RangeQuery(GUID guid,
                  Type type,
                  int hops,
                  String algorithm,
                  String minQuery,
                  String maxQuery,
                  KeyRange kr,
                  int index,
                  String prefix,
                  int minSpeed,
                  PGridHost initialHost)
Construct a range query message

Parameters:
guid - the unique range query number
type - the type of the query
algorithm - to use
minQuery - least bound
maxQuery - max bound
index - represent the resolved portion of the query
minSpeed - the connection speed
initialHost - host that should recieve the result set

RangeQuery

public RangeQuery(Type type,
                  KeyRange key,
                  String firstQuery,
                  String secondQuery,
                  int minSpeed)
Creates a new Query for a given search string. It is assumed that this peer is the initiator of the query and its address will be bound with the query as the destination for the result set. This constructor should not be used to route a query.

Parameters:
type - the type of Query.
firstQuery - lower bound string
secondQuery - higher bound string
minSpeed - the mininum connection speed for responding host.

RangeQuery

public RangeQuery(GUID guid,
                  Type type,
                  KeyRange key,
                  String firstQuery,
                  String secondQuery,
                  int minSpeed)
Creates a new Query for a given search string. It is assumed that this peer is the initiator of the query and its address will be bound with the query as the destination for the result set. This constructor should not be used to route a query.

Parameters:
guid - the guid
type - the type of Query.
firstQuery - lower bound string
secondQuery - higher bound string
minSpeed - the mininum connection speed for responding host.

RangeQuery

public RangeQuery(PGridHost host,
                  Type type,
                  KeyRange key,
                  String firstQuery,
                  String secondQuery)
Creates a new Query for a given search string. It is assumed that this peer is the initiator of the query and its address will be bound with the query as the destination for the result set. This constructor should not be used to route a query.

Parameters:
host - Initiator host
type - the type of Query.
firstQuery - lower bound string
secondQuery - higher bound string

getLowerBound

public String getLowerBound()
Description copied from interface: Query
Get the lower bound of the range query string that defines the query, e.g. a keyword such as 'Madonna' or a semantic query such as '<predicate>Actor</predicate><object>Madonna</object>'.

Specified by:

Returns:
Returns the SecondQueryString.
